title: Engine - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Exhaust intermediate and header pipe Removal DF4; DG4
Remove the exhaust intermediate and header pipes (see
Exhaust Intermediate and Header Pipes - Removal
Engine Oil and Filter - Renew DF4; DG4
From the top of the frame, disconnect the following electrical connectors:
Detach the coolant top hose from the thermostat housing.
Disconnect the clutch cable from the crankcase (see
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.

body.name: Rear Brake Res (side panel connectors DD2)

body.body: Remove the fixings securing the front sprocket cover to the crankcase.
Remove the lock nuts and detach the coolant expansion tank from its mounting. Discard the lock nuts.
Remove the fixings, detach the alternator harness and remove the coolant expansion tank mounting.
From the right hand side, disconnect the following electrical connectors:
Starter motor cable from the starter motor solenoid.
Disconnect the oil pressure switch electrical connector.

body.name: Low Oil Pressure Warning Light Switch ciua_1.svg)

body.body: Noting their orientation route the cables away from the frame.
Loosen the drive chain and remove it from the front sprocket (see
Undo the fixing securing the gear change actuator arm to the splined shaft.
Remove the two fixings and detach the left hand heel guard from the left hand control plate. Discard the fixings.
Remove the two fixings and detach the left hand control plate from the frame, noting the position of the gear change pedal for installation.
Carefully remove the swinging arm pivot cover on the left hand side of the frame.
Remove the swinging arm pivot nut and collect the washer on the right hand side of the frame.
Support the swinging arm and remove the swinging arm spindle and washer from the left hand side.
Partially fit the swinging arm spindle on the right hand side to support the swinging arm.
in the slots of the frame adjuster sleeve and rotate anticlockwise to loosen the sleeve fully.
Note the routing of the brake switch harness for installation.
Note the routing of the alternator harness and its clips for installation.
Route the alternator harness with the grey electrical connector to the alternator cover.
From the left hand side, disconnect the engine earth strap.
Place a support beneath the engine and ensure that the frame is still adequately and securely supported.
Release the engine mounting nuts. Collect the nuts and washers, leaving the bolts in position.
Remove the left hand cylinder head mounting bolt.
Rear cylinder head mounting adjuster on the left side of the frame,
Left hand cylinder head mounting adjuster.
Remove the right hand cylinder head mounting bolt.
Remove the remaining mounting bolts, collecting the spacer from the lower crankcase mounting bolt.
Two brake lines are attached to the brake line tidy on the rear of the crankcase.
Failure to detach the brake lines from the brake line tidy will cause damage to the braking system.
Detach the brake lines from the brake line tidy and position away from the crankcase.
Brake line from ABS modulator to front master cylinder
Brake line from ABS modulator to front brake caliper
Lower the engine away from the frame, taking care to avoid damage to the brake pipes.

search: Engine - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Throttle Body - Removal
Remove the exhaust intermediate and header pipes (see
Exhaust Intermediate and Header Pipes - Removal
Radiator - Removal
Engine Oil and Filter Renew
From the top of the frame, disconnect the following electrical connectors:
Spark plug leads.
Fuel injectors
Coolant temperature sensor.
Detach the coolant top hose from the thermostat housing.
Disconnect the clutch cable from the crankcase (see
Clutch Cable - Removal
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.
Fixing
Brake fluid reservoir
Remove the fixings securing the front sprocket cover to the crankcase.
Remove the lock nuts and detach the coolant expansion tank from its mounting. Discard the lock nuts.
Lock nuts
Coolant expansion tank
Remove the fixings, detach the alternator harness and remove the coolant expansion tank mounting.
Fixings
Harness clip
Alternator harness
From the right hand side, disconnect the following electrical connectors:
Gear position sensor.
Crankshaft position sensor.
Starter motor cable from the starter motor solenoid.
Crankshaft position sensor connector
Gear position sensor connector
Starter motor cable
Starter motor solenoid
Disconnect the oil pressure switch electrical connector.
Electrical connector
Noting their orientation route the cables away from the frame.
Loosen the drive chain and remove it from the front sprocket (see
Final Drive Chain Adjustment
Undo the fixing securing the gear change actuator arm to the splined shaft.
Remove the two fixings and detach the left hand heel guard from the left hand control plate. Discard the fixings.
Remove the two fixings and detach the left hand control plate from the frame, noting the position of the gear change pedal for installation.
Gear change actuator clamp fixing
Control plate
Fixings
Carefully remove the swinging arm pivot cover on the left hand side of the frame.
Remove the swinging arm pivot nut and collect the washer on the right hand side of the frame.
Nut
Washer
Support the swinging arm and remove the swinging arm spindle and washer from the left hand side.
Partially fit the swinging arm spindle on the right hand side to support the swinging arm.
Engage
service tool T3880104
in the slots of the frame adjuster sleeve and rotate anticlockwise to loosen the sleeve fully.
Frame adjuster
T3880104 - Swinging Arm Adjuster Wrench
Note the routing of the brake switch harness for installation.
Remove the alternator regulator/rectifier (see
Alternator Regulator/Rectifier - Removal
Note the routing of the alternator harness and its clips for installation.
Route the alternator harness with the grey electrical connector to the alternator cover.
From the left hand side, disconnect the engine earth strap.
Place a support beneath the engine and ensure that the frame is still adequately and securely supported.
Release the engine mounting nuts. Collect the nuts and washers, leaving the bolts in position.
Remove the left hand cylinder head mounting bolt.
Using
service tool T3880377
release the:
Rear cylinder head mounting adjuster on the left side of the frame,
Upper rear crankcase mounting adjuster,
Lower rear crankcase mounting adjuster,
Left hand cylinder head mounting adjuster.
Remove the right hand cylinder head mounting bolt.
Remove the remaining mounting bolts, collecting the spacer from the lower crankcase mounting bolt.
Two brake lines are attached to the brake line tidy on the rear of the crankcase.
Failure to detach the brake lines from the brake line tidy will cause damage to the braking system.
Detach the brake lines from the brake line tidy and position away from the crankcase.
Brake line from ABS modulator to front master cylinder
Brake line from ABS modulator to front brake caliper
Brake line tidy
Lower the engine away from the frame, taking care to avoid damage to the brake pipes.
